name: You Pick the Team Quiz | American Football | 10 Questions

questions.text: This franchise played in Cleveland, Los Angeles, and St. Louis.  Which team is this?
questions.explanation:
Rams.

	The Rams began their NFL hopes and dreams in Cleveland in 1937.  It took them eight seasons to have a winning record.  But after their winning record of 9-1 in 1945, the team moved to Los Angeles.  After having the limelight touching six decades in Los Angeles, the team then moved to St. Louis in 1995.  The Rams went to their first Super Bowl in 1980, but did not prevent the Steelers from winning their fourth Super Bowl crown.

questions.text: This team in 1983 made the playoffs for the first time in their franchise history.  Curt Warner rushed for over 200 yards in a game, and QB Dave Krieg had a 400-yard passing game also.  Which team was this?
questions.explanation:
Seattle Seahawks.

	The Seahawks finished 9-7 in 1983 with Chuck Knox at the helm in his first season.  The Seahawks made it to the Conference Championship game, but lost to the Raiders.  Seattle improved to 12-4 in 1984.

questions.text: This team began their NFL endeavors in 1960, and went 0-11-1 in their first season.  It would take the team seven seasons before they had a winning record.  In that 1966 season, they would make the playoffs for the first time in their history, but lose to the Packers in the Conference Championship game.  Running back Dan Reeves had over 1300 combined yards for the team in 1966.  Which team was this?
questions.explanation:
Dallas Cowboys.

	While Reeves had 757 yards rushing, and another 557 from the air, fullback Don Perkins also rushed for 726 yards.  The Cowboys also had QB Don Merideth, who was in his seventh season with Dallas.

questions.text: The first NFL Championship game took place in 1933, and continued each year until the Super Bowl was introduced between the AFL and NFL.  In the first 10 NFL Championships, the Chicago Bears were in it six times.  Which other team also appeared in the big game six times?
questions.explanation:
New York Giants.

	The other teams did not make an appearance in the first 10 NFL Championship games.  The Giants were in the first three NFL Championships, and came away with one win.  Their six appearances watched them walk away with only two NFL crowns.  The Bears won three of their six championship games.

questions.text: This 1991 team did not have a running back rush for even 500 yards, but they did have Michael Haynes who caught 1122 passing yards.  The team also saw Brett Favre as a rookie in 1991.  Which team was this?
questions.explanation:
Atlanta Falcons.

	1991 was Favre's only season with the Falcons, and he played in only two games.  The second round draft pick just didn't impress head coach Jerry Glanville.  The Falcons defeated the Saints in the wildcard game, but were then defeated in the Divisional Championship game by the Redskins.  The following season found Brett as a Packer, and the rest is history.

questions.text: In 1989, this NFL team went a respectable 11-5 in the season.  In Super Bowl XXIV, they went up against the 14-2 San Francisco 49ers, but forgot to wear their game-face as they lost 55-10.  Which team was this?
questions.explanation:
Denver Broncos.

	The Louisiana Superdome in New Orleans saw this blowout of a game.  The 49ers led 27-3 by halftime.  The only touchdown scored by the Broncos was a three-yard run by QB John Elway.  49er QB Joe Montana hooked up with wide receiver Jerry Rice for seven receptions and 148 yards.

questions.text: Which NFL team was on the losing end of the NFL Championship game which they lost 73-0?
questions.explanation:
Washington Redskins.

	The 1940 Chicago Bears went 8-3 in the season.  They went up against the Washington Redskins who went 9-2.  The Bears had the Redskins where they wanted them by halftime, 28-0.  By the end of the third quarter it was 54-0.  Chicago's total yardage was 519, compared to 231 by the Redskins.

questions.text: This franchise began in the AFL in 1960, and later merged with the NFL in 1970.  The franchise found themselves in the first Super Bowl.  What was the name of this franchise in 1960?
questions.explanation:
Dallas Texans.

	The Texans were guided by head coach Hank Stram to a 9-7 record in their first season.  In 1963, the franchise moved to Kansas City to become the Chiefs.  In 1966, the Chiefs went 11-2-1, and met the Green Bay Packers in the first Super Bowl.  The Packers won the game 35-10.

questions.text: Which team was the first in NFL history to have two 1000-yard rushers in the same season?
questions.explanation:
Miami Dolphins.

	The 1972 Dolphins set numerous records in 1972.  One was that the team went a perfect 14-0 in the regular season.  With Larry Csonka rushing for 1117 yards, Mercury Morris rushed for 997 yards.  Morris was later credited with three yards to give him 1000.  The team was guided by the legendary head coach Don Shula, and the Dolphins won the Super Bowl against the Redskins.

questions.text: This Chicago team began their play in the APFA in 1920, which became the NFL in 1922.  They've also played in St. Louis and Phoenix.  Which team is this?
questions.explanation:
Cardinals.

	The team played in Chicago until 1960, but the city wasn't big enough to support two NFL teams with the Bears taking the limelight.  The team moved to St. Louis with the Cardinals name still intact, then moved to Phoenix in 1988.  They changed their name to the Arizona Cardinals in 1994.
